skill.name: product-manager-toolkit
skill.description: Comprehensive toolkit for product managers including RICE prioritization, customer interview analysis, PRD templates, discovery frameworks, and go-to-market strategies. Use for feature prioritization, user research synthesis, requirement documentation, and product strategy development.
skill.summary: Comprehensive toolkit for product managers including RICE prioritization, customer interview analysi...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 95 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner misidentified markdown documentation syntax (bash code blocks), business terminology (TAM/SAM/SOM market metrics), and security best-practice references as security threats. The actual Python scripts (rice_prioritizer.py, customer_interview_analyzer.py) contain only pure data processing code with no subprocess calls, network operations, credential access, or data exfiltration patterns. This is a legitimate product management skill.

content.value_statement: Product managers struggle to prioritize competing feature requests objectively. This toolkit provides RICE prioritization, customer interview analysis, and PRD templates to make data-driven decisions.
actual_capabilities: Calculate RICE scores for features using the proven Reach x Impact x Confidence / Effort formula
Analyze customer interview transcripts to extract pain points, feature requests, and sentiment
Generate quarterly roadmaps with capacity planning across multiple quarters
Create professional PRDs using templates for standard, one-page, agile epic, and feature brief formats
Identify quick wins and big bets in feature portfolio for balanced prioritization
limitations: Does not integrate with external tools like Jira, Linear, or Figma - outputs are local files
Interview analysis is keyword-based NLP, not AI-powered semantic understanding
RICE scores require manual input for reach, impact, confidence, and effort values

use_cases.title: Prioritize feature backlog
use_cases.description: Score and rank feature requests using RICE to build quarterly roadmaps

use_cases.title: Analyze interview transcripts
use_cases.description: Extract pain points, themes, and feature requests from customer interviews

use_cases.title: Document product requirements
use_cases.description: Create professional PRDs to align engineering and design teams

prompt_templates.title: Prioritize feature list
prompt_templates.scenario: Create sample data and run prioritization
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the rice_prioritizer to create sample_features.csv then prioritize with capacity of 20 person-months

prompt_templates.title: Analyze customer interview
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the interview_transcript.txt using customer_interview_analyzer and output as JSON

prompt_templates.title: Compare feature trade-offs
prompt_templates.prompt: Run rice_prioritizer on features.csv and identify the quick wins versus big bets

prompt_templates.title: Generate quarterly roadmap
prompt_templates.prompt: Use rice_prioritizer with --capacity 15 to generate a quarterly roadmap for the prioritized features

output_examples.input: Create sample CSV and run RICE prioritization
output: Quick Wins Identified: Dark Mode, API Rate Limiting
Big Bets Identified: Team Collaboration, User Dashboard Redesign
Quarter 1 Roadmap: 5 features using 11/15 person-months capacity
Top Pain Point: frustrated - waste of time doing manually
Feature Request: would be nice to have - automated workflow (priority: medium)

best_practices: Update RICE scores quarterly as confidence and reach data improves
Combine RICE with strategic alignment - high score does not always mean right priority
Validate interview analysis with multiple transcripts before making major decisions
anti_patterns: Using RICE without considering dependencies between features
Analyzing single interviews for major product decisions
Ignoring quick wins in favor of only big bets

faq.question: What input format does rice_prioritizer expect?
faq.answer: CSV with columns: name, reach, impact, confidence, effort, description. Impact uses massive/high/medium/low/minimal.

faq.question: Can I customize the RICE scoring formula?
faq.answer: The formula is fixed (Reach x Impact x Confidence / Effort) but impact multipliers are configurable in the code.

faq.question: What NLP patterns does the interview analyzer detect?
faq.answer: Pain indicators, delight indicators, feature request phrases, Jobs-to-be-Done patterns, and competitor mentions.

faq.question: How many interviews should I analyze?
faq.answer: For reliable patterns, analyze at least 5-10 interviews. The tool aggregates across multiple files.

faq.question: Can I export results to Jira or Linear?
faq.answer: Export as JSON or CSV, then import. No direct integration exists. Manual mapping required.

faq.question: What RICE confidence levels map to percentages?
faq.answer: High = 100%, Medium = 80%, Low = 50%. These are configurable in the script.
